‘⁴ Srn: Ι have the honor to report the result of “deep sea soundings,” taken at noon this day.

It being perfectly calm, and the ship having no perceptible drift, a fair up and down measurement was obtained with the sounding twine and two 32 lb. shot. Bottom was struck at one thousand seven hundred and eighty fathoms (1‚780 fathomS.)

Upon attempting to haul in, the line parted at about two hundred sathoms from the reel ; the line used, however, is of better quality than any heretofore tried.
